import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.express as px
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots

            x=df['date_fifth_death'][0:10], y=df['country_name'][0:10],
            text=df['country_name'][0:10],
            textposition='auto',
            marker_color='red',
 
        )])
fig.update_layout(
    title='Date 5th Covid19 death case',
    xaxis_title="date_fifth_death",
    yaxis_title="Country",
    template='plotly_dark'
)
fig.show()

source.9df9c95a:
#Nepal reports its fifth Covid-19 death and 156 new cases; national tally crosses 1,000


Nepal on Thursday confirmed its fifth Covid-19 death and 156 new cases. The country’s Covid-19 tally now has reached 1,042.

“The patient was admitted to the hospital on May 24,2020 and tested positive for the coronavirus the following day,” “The patient was suffering from liver disease.” The ministry also said 156 new cases were confirmed in 19 districts.

According to the ministry, samples of 29 individuals from Dhanusha, 25 from Jhapa, 20 from Rautahat, 17 from Mahottari, 14 each from Saptari Surkhet, eight from Dailekh, seven from Sarlahi, six from Siraha, three each from Syangja and Bardiya, two each from Dolakha Kailali and one each from Nawalparasi (East), Solukhumbu, Darchula, Makwanpur, Bajhanag and Banke tested positive for Covid-19. 
Nepal recorded 114 new Covid-19 cases on Wednesday, 90 cases on Tuesday and 79 cases Monday. 
According to the Health Ministry, the coronavirus infection has so far been reported in 51 districts. https://kathmandupost.com/national/2020/05/28/nepal-reports-its-fifth-covid-19-death-and-156-new-cases-national-tally-crosses-1-000
